summary: This document is a criminal history record response from the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services to an FBI request, providing identification and criminal history information for an individual. The document contains standard caveats about multi-source data and sentencing information.

persons.name: Michael C. Green
persons.role: Executive Deputy Commissioner of the NYS Division of Criminal Justice Services
persons.context: Listed as the executive deputy commissioner of the agency providing the criminal history information in response to an FBI request.

locations: Alfred E. Smith Building, 80 South Swan St. Albany, New York 12210
New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services
keyFacts: The document is a criminal history record response from New York State to an FBI request dated October 6, 2021.
The record includes standard caveats about multi-source data maintained by other states or in multiple NYS files through the Interstate Identification Index.
The document references sentencing rules for cases where an individual is sentenced on multiple charges after June 1, 1981.
The response appears to be part of a delayed response process between state and federal law enforcement agencies.
